Reviews.Title: “business trip”
Reviews.Author: vickyak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight for a business trip. Literally in at 9pm and out at 8am. It was perfect for my purposes, yes the room is small but it is clean and the staff friendly. bathroom a bit dated and small but nice hot shower. I got good value for money on a last minute deal. Would recommend it for this purpose but not for staying any length of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if at all possible...”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for a company event. However, on arrival (and after we had paid in full!) we were then told we would actually be staying in another of their hotels directly across the road - what?!? The other hotel was dire, it had not been touched or decorated since at least the 70's, there was mould in the bathrooms, no reception area (just a doorbell), threadbare carpets, musty smell in corridors and rooms etc, etc. How can a hotel take a booking using images and reviews on one hotel and then send you to another which is in appalling condition? Avoid booking into this hotel at all costs, you may find yourself staying somewhere that you hadn't expected....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Jules8377
Reviews.Content: Me & my partner stayed here for 2 nights in June, we needed place close to hyde park for a gig and somewhere with parking which was only £10 per day which is nothing in London. Staff where lovely. We basically only slept in the room as they are rather on the small size if you’re looking for somewhere cheap and to crash I recommend Springfield however if you want luxury pay the price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Only in emergency”
Reviews.Author: anaperes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springfield only because we arrived one day earlier and didn't have a hotel for the night. We were in four and they had a family room available and it was conveniently near the hotel we had booked for the next day. Unfortunately the room was at the top floor and there wasn't a lift so we had to carry our luggage up 6 flights of steep steps. The room and the bathroom were very small, but we could manage to have a bath in spite of the broken shower and the sewer smell. Breakfast was included but the rate was too high for what we got. Thankfully it was just for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible plumbing! smell in room impossible”
Reviews.Author: rosei_11
Reviews.Content: although great location and decent enough breakfast there was an obvious plumbing problem. Any time the shower was used the room was filled with a dirty sewer smell as if the water then diturbes something nasty lurking beneath. could not stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible place”
Reviews.Author: misty081
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel 15th-17th oct 2010, room on top floor which does not really bother us, but when we got to it. cracks in part of ceiling, damp patches on other parts. toilet looked like it had not seenn cleaner for years, could not use bedside unit no handle on it.having breakfast another guest asked for 3 continental and 1english breakfast to which he was told by the waitress she did not know what a continental breakfast was, after about 10 mins they gave up and all had english. they will not refund you your money so you can go elsewhere.dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory accomodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: F1F1
Reviews.Content: Good welcome on arrival,room ok.As we need a quad room a put u up bed was put in but collapsed each time it was sat on so reverted to sleeping on a mattress! Room was clean, bedding fine and clean towels every day. Breakfast good,set us up for the day. as a whole the accomodation met all our needs as somewhere to sleep at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on fair price”
Reviews.Author: BiserDimitrov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient located just close to two metro stations. Neighborhood is nice. The rooms were quite small and the bathrooms were quite small. The checkout time is quite early - 10am. Make sure to close the windows so you can have a sleep because of the busy street outside. In conclusion the hotel served its purpose - good location on fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but well located”
Reviews.Author: Rockyroad2dublin
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Springfield for more than thirty years, both recently and with previous owners. I stay there wehn I am in London on business on my own; I prefer to take my significant other to slightly more upmarket places. Having said that, the Springfield is great if you just want a place to sleep that's easy to get to from Heathrow (15 mins on Heathrow Express). The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. Breakfast is the usual English Breakfast, but you won't go hungry with generous portions. So, if you just want a place to lay your head for a night or two, and you need to be close to the West End and the airport, you could do worse than the Springfield. Don't expect big spacious rooms with widescreen TV though, and you won't be disapponted. Good basic B&B hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: ashersk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but there is a lot to be desired in this hotel. there is no lift we had to carry out bags up four flights of stairs. The breakfast was fine but the staff were not very friendly . The rooms are in desperate need of refurbishment. There was stains on the ceiling and the window wouldn't open. There was paint feeling off the ceiling in the bathroom and and the light didn't work. We only stayed there two nights and at this price you cant expect much

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BrenNorthamptonshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel with some trepidation having read the reviews after we had booked. We were greeted by a very friendly polite receptionist. The room was in need of refurbishment but was clean enough. The dining room was clean and fresh the breakfast was fine. Because we were using the hotel just as a base we did not intend to spend much time in the room. The location we like and have stayed at various hotels in Sussex Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “A hostel would have been just as good if booking online”
Reviews.Author: Ruthmeister
Reviews.Content: Got to hotel about 11am. The guy at the desk was friendly but as we were early for check in, we had to leave our bags in the main hall or wait til 1pm. We left the bags and when we came back at 9:30pm they were still in the hallway. Lucky the guests were honest. The room was disguisting! Paint peeling off the walls, dirty sheets which werent even covering the mattress properly and a bathroom that was only fit for a campsite. The manager was arrogant refused to change our room, give us a discount or allow us to leave. He said that because we hadnt cancelled the room in 72 hours we would be charged whether we stayed or not. He didnt seem to get the point that we wanted to leave because the place was terrible and we didnt know that 72 hours before check in!!! Apparntly because we booked ONLINE and got a good rate, we were given aroom that reflected this! Breakfast followed the same standard. The english breakfast was a disgrace we couldnt eat them and the continental breakfast was cornflakes and toast. Would never ever stay here again or recommend to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Should be cheaper for the level of service...”
Reviews.Author: fcn14
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 days ...Front desk staff made an error with our booking when we arrived and we were asked to check out the day before we had planned to until we showed our invoice and proof of the error we had been treated like frauds.....despite this lapse on their part we were still relocated to an inferior room for the same price! However, in fairness to them they tried to improve service levels after this but i guess the damage had already been done. On a separate note one of the ladies in the breakfast room was borderline rude and consistently served without a smile as though more interested to get you out and close the kitchen by 9am.

Reviews.Title: “could do better”
Reviews.Author: londonvisitor15
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit dingy and dark. Looked onto the boiler room courtyard. Problem with the shower being too hot, so unable to shower on our first day until fixed - management helpful with this though. Biggest concern was that they charged a 5% surcharge for payment with credit card, and this wasn't mentioned either on booking or until I came to check out, so no time to make other arrangements. Very upset about this!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sanddaal
Reviews.Content: Its been 3 yrs since we stayed at Springfield but reading some of these reviews it seems nothing has changed. I still have memories of our less than impressive stay there. When we arrived during the day the man at the counter couldnt even bother looking at us and smiling. Kept his head down and was less than helpful with any questions I asked. Couldnt even muster a 'hello' or 'welcome' when we arrived. The room was adequate but very outdated. The toilet however was awful. Seat was broken, water leaking. They said they'd fix the problem but never did. So every time we sat on the loo the seat fell to the side. Not good for a female thats for sure! No lifts so we had to carry our suitcases up about 4 flights of narrow stairs. Breakfast was nice but again the man doing the cooking was rather rude. This was not the same man as in reception so it tells you something about their staff. We travelled to Windsor for a few days and asked before booking if we could leave some luggage at the hotel as we intended to stay for a few more days on our return. This was confirmed as fine however the same cook (I assume was the manager) argued about this with the same staff member. It was a rediculous scene. If we could of stayed somewhere else we most certainly would of. On our next visit we will definitely not stay at this b & b.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory b+b”
Reviews.Author: tripsterDonegal
Reviews.Content: more a b+b than hotel as it had no bar or lounge.decor was a bit dated,en suite was dated and needs refurbishment,breakfast was fine and staff were helpful.stayed 2 nights so it was ok for short visit.handy for circle line

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But.....”
Reviews.Author: David_Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic location and you get what you pay for, but be aware of a few problems we encountered: We had 3 rooms for 3 nights, there is no lift so if you are on the top floor be prepared to lug your bags up a lot of stairs. There is no air-con, which worked out OK. The toilet seat in one room was broken off, the timber surround around the shower fell off in another room, the bifold shower door was broken in two in our third room. This property could do with some maintenance. The breakfast was very good considering the cost. Our biggest problem was that the hotel staff showed people through the hotel - in our room while we were out! This hotel is located in a long street which is nothing but hotel properties. I'm sure there is something in the same location that is a better quality.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: natashawitch
Reviews.Content: I must praise the Springfield Hotel where i stayed for 4 nights. It is a B+B hotel. The staff were friendly. The breakfast was very good with excellent sausages. The room was warm, but not too warm, with a lovely ensuite shower. TV had the 5 UK channels. Beds were comfortable and clean, and were made up each day. Any towels used were changed daily. Location was very easy and quick for access to the tube at Paddington. Check out is 11am but i had some time to kill before i had to go for my train and i sat in the reception sitting room watching the large TV, very comfortable. The only downside was one that they can't help - the traffic noise. Sussex Gardens can be a noisy road, but the same would be true for any of the many B&Bs on this road. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cosy,clean,comfortable,warm,friendly,relaxing,classically and newly decorated.Good fresh delicious breakfast. Have booked my nextther stay when I travel to London 3 weeks in advance and will do from now, on cannot say more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but.............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, to go to a music festival in Hyde Park - very good area and central location. However, we encountered a problem with our booking upon arrival, and found the staff to be unfriendly. Our room was in need of refurbishment and was quite dark. The shower was rusted, and we could not get any hot water from the taps. On the morning of our stay it rained and their was a leak from the ceiling onto our bed - nice!! The breakfast wasn't up to much either. Would not stay here again, and would not recommend it until it is refurbished. If you want to stay in this area, I would recommend the Hyde Park Radnor Hotel just around the corner - excellent, but book early.

Reviews.Title: “For what it is, a great bargain in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LikesTravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Springfield, using it as home base for a really great London (and Bath and Paris) exploration vacation. Location was great for us, just two blocks from Paddington (tube, National Rail, Heathrow Express; bus stops galore). It's a small, family-owned place, no elevator, no A/C. Rooms are small by American standards, but completely serviceable and clean. A small TV and a tacked-on toilet/shower combo built in to one side. Some street noise, some adjacent room noise, but nothing we couldn't live with for 65 GBP/night. The place grew on us. We particularly liked breakfast -- traditional English breakfast included in the tariff, and it was very good, indeed. Dining room is in the "basement," appeared recently remodeled; clean; individual service from the owners themselves. No other meals served. Hotel puts you in walking distance to Kensington area, but better yet, at just two minutes to Paddington, buy a week's unlimited Zone 1 transit pass and you'll find nearly everything you want to see just a short bus or tube ride away. Take the Heathrow Express to and from Paddington; well worth the fare. Overall, the Springfield ain't the Plaza. Don't go there for luxury. But as a place to rest between museums and shops and day trips, it does just fine.

HotelInfo.Name: Springfield Hotel London
HotelInfo.Address: 154 Sussex Gardens, London W2 1UD, England
